intro: Asperula lutea var. pulvinaris, commonly known as the yellow woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks.
